Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of people deported every year by stating that "millions of people are deported every year," which is false.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that "using the existing laws, millions of people are deported every year," which is not true.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to back up the statement that millions of people are deported every year.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that there is a consensus that millions of people are deported every year, which is not true.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times as it contradicts previous statements made by Donald Trump regarding his stance on deportation.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, as it is mentioned that Trump may clear up the confusion in a future speech.
